title: 4-Level Pulmonary Embolism Clinical Probability Score (4PEPS)
description: Clinical probability score for suspected pulmonary embolism using 13 clinical variables to safely decrease imaging testing needs

parameters.name: chronic_respiratory_disease
parameters.description: Presence of chronic respiratory disease (COPD, asthma, pulmonary fibrosis, etc.)

parameters.name: heart_rate_under_80
parameters.description: Heart rate less than 80 beats per minute

parameters.name: chest_pain_dyspnea
parameters.description: Presence of both chest pain and acute dyspnea

parameters.name: hormonal_treatment
parameters.description: Hormonal estrogenic treatment (oral contraceptives, hormone replacement therapy)

parameters.name: personal_history_vte
parameters.description: Personal history of venous thromboembolism (DVT or PE)

parameters.name: immobility_4_weeks
parameters.description: Immobility within the last 4 weeks (bed rest, wheelchair, cast, etc.)

parameters.name: calf_pain_edema
parameters.description: Calf pain and/or unilateral lower limb edema

parameters.name: pe_most_likely
parameters.description: PE is the most likely diagnosis (clinician's judgment)

ranges.interpretation: PE ruled out - no testing needed. Risk of PE <1%. No D-dimer or imaging required.
Low probability of PE. Use D-dimer with 1000 μg/L cut-off. If D-dimer <1000 μg/L, PE is ruled out.
Moderate probability of PE. Use age-adjusted D-dimer cut-off (age × 10 μg/L for patients >50 years). If below threshold, PE is ruled out.
High probability of PE. Proceed directly to imaging (CTPA or V/Q scan). D-dimer not recommended.

references: Roy PM, Friou E, Germeau B, Douillet D, Kline JA, Righini M, et al. Derivation and Validation of a 4-Level Clinical Pretest Probability Score for Suspected Pulmonary Embolism to Safely Decrease Imaging Testing. JAMA Cardiol. 2021 Jun 1;6(6):669-677. doi: 10.1001/jamacardio.2021.0064.

Stals MAM, Beenen LFM, Coppens M, Faber LM, Hofstee HMA, Hovens MMC, et al. Performance of the 4-Level Pulmonary Embolism Clinical Probability Score (4PEPS) in the diagnostic management of pulmonary embolism: An external validation study. Thromb Res. 2023 Nov;231:65-75. doi: 10.1016/j.thromres.2023.09.010.

Chiang P, Robert-Ebadi H, Perrier A, Roy PM, Sanchez O, Righini M, et al. Pulmonary embolism risk stratification: external validation of the 4-level Clinical Pretest Probability Score (4PEPS). Res Pract Thromb Haemost. 2024 Feb 15;8(1):102348. doi: 10.1016/j.rpth.2024.102348.
formula: Sum of weighted clinical variables: Age <50 (-2), Age 50-64 (-1), Chronic respiratory disease (-1), Heart rate <80 (-1), Chest pain + dyspnea (+1), Male (+2), Hormonal treatment (+2), Personal history VTE (+2), Syncope (+2), Immobility 4 weeks (+2), O2 sat <95% (+3), Calf pain/edema (+3), PE most likely (+5)
notes: The 4PEPS score can safely rule out PE in 58% of patients without imaging
Score comprises 13 criteria that may be difficult to memorize - recommend using electronic calculator
Timing of vital signs should be assessed using clinician judgment
This score was designed specifically to reduce unnecessary imaging in suspected PE
Age-adjusted D-dimer for moderate probability: age × 10 μg/L for patients >50 years
